param.name: peak_file
param.label: Data matrix
param.help: Data matrix containing the integrated signals for the samples. The first two columns represent the mass and the retention time of the peaks; the other columns represent peak intensities for each sample.

param.name: target_selector
param.label: Input targets from file?
param.help: Choose if you want to provide targets file, or if you want to enter targets manually.

param.name: targ_file
param.label: Targets matrix
param.help: A data matrix containing information on the target analytes. Columns 1 to 8 are: 'name_compound' (the name of the target analytes), 'compound', 'charge', 'labelling', 'RT', 'RT_shift', 'chrom_width', 'mass_shift'. Columns from 9 onwards contain the initial estimates for the label abundances (one estimate for each sample). If not known, a single column of NA values can be entered

param.name: target_output
param.label: Output generated targets input files?
param.help: Choose if you want to output the generated targets.

param.name: name_compound
param.label: Specify a compound name
param.help: Letters, numbers and underscores will be allowed

param.name: compound
param.label: Specify a compound name
param.help: Letters and numbers will be allowed

param.name: initial_abundance
param.label: Specify an initial abundance
param.help: Letters and numbers will be allowed

param.name: grp_selector
param.label: Average estimate within groups
param.help: Calculate summary statistics for the samples belonging to the same group.

param.name: groups
param.label: Specify group information
param.help: A vector containing the name of the group of each sample analysed.

param.name: pattern_plot
param.label: Plot patterns
param.help: Plot the normalized experimental pattern superimposed to its fitted theoretical pattern.

param.name: residual_plot
param.label: Plot residuals
param.help: Plot the residuals (the differences between experimental and best fitted theoretical patterns)

param.name: result_plot
param.label: Plot results
param.help: Plot summary showing the estimated percentage abundances with related standard errors.

tool.help: This is a basic Galaxy wrapper for pre-processing.
